bboxes.raw_text:
MCCOMB, Miss. : Twenty Ne
groes, led by Charles Eers state
field director of the National AS
ISOLATION for the Advancement of
Colored People, quietly desegre-
gated two hotels, movie theater,
restaurants and drug store lunch
counters Nov. 10.


In McComb, whites watched ST.
lently as the group entered the
establishments in a test of the
law. All we're served without
incident. A force of 40 state
patrolmen and 20 FBI agents
joined local police in watching
over the group.


Desegregation of the facilities
followed publication of a state
ment signed by $50 leading Nc
Comb, residents calling for re-
establishment of order and re-
spect for law.


Business places desegregated
included the lunch counter in
Woolworth's and dining and
rooming facilities in the Con-
tinental Hotel and Holiday Inn
Motel.

Hats off to the Grand Canyon
Temple 437 of Elks who brought
that fine show to the club la st
Saturday. Beverly Harris. sing
er and dancer was very talented.


If you are suffering from BE
go down to the VFW on Mondays
and enjoy some spicy chilli while
listening to the jazz sessions.


The subteen unit of Jack and
jill Club will ice skate Nov. %,
IA.


Miss Estelle Voner, laboratory
technician of New York, is the
houseguest of MIR. and Mrs. Cla-
renee Green.


Debonairs Social and Art Club
will hold its annual Christina
party for underprivileged young
sters on Dec. H..


Arizona State Baptist Conven-
ton is meeting Nov. 24-2o at
Mt. Calvary Baptist Church.


MIR. and Mrs. Jimmy Thomas
and family of San Francisco, are
visiting his parents S, Mr.. and Mrs.
Leroy Engram.


Mrs. Thomas was happy to see
her sisters, Miss Blenda Thomas
and Mrs. Wanda Collins, too.
Hurry and get we'll wishes are
extended to Lille (Bunch) Conley
who is in Good Samaritan Hos
pital.


Those Merry Mixers are spon-
soring the 18th annual dance,
Thurs, Nov. 26 at the Ma sonic
Temple.


Young ladies', employed in
business or industry or college
students are asked to volunteer
and help entertain many young
servicemen and women located
in the Valley.


WCA program director Shir-
ley Dunklebarger-AM. ,4-38ll,
can give you further information.
Thought of the Week--Kind
hearts are more than coronets.


Tennyson

DR.. Richard E. Faust has stated
that: "Of all topical measures, the
use of soap and water is perhaps
the most important, and should be
considered the cornerstone of all
acne therapy."


Call your teenager's attention
to this assurance that routine of
several face-washings with soap
and warm water every day is
sound treatment for blemished
skin.

Soap Plays Beneficial
Role In Treating Acne

sign of The Centaur mentally
sicay active Your cheerful amabe
all your company spirits. deep
such abundance responsible for your basic
optimism hope You quick your
shifting the blame else Choose your
under the sign of Cemn Leo Thursday lucky
3, your lucky number.

full articles.headline:
IMMIGRATION
TRIED IN McCOMB

MCCOMB, Miss. : Twenty Ne
groes, led by Charles Eers state
field director of the National AS

rooming facilities in the Con-
tinental Hotel and Holiday Inn
Motel.

Soap Plays Beneficial
Role In Treating Acne
full articles.article:
DR.. Richard E. Faust has stated
that: "Of all topical measures, the
use of soap and water is perhaps

and warm water every day is
